intro: Hieracium rigidicaule, commonly known as rigid hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with upright, hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often reddish in color. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium rigidicaule is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites, and it can form dense colonies due to its extensive root system.
